action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +3} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

monster.name: Drowned Thrall
languages: Understands all languages it spoke in life but doesn't speak

trait.name: Slow Start
entries: When rolling initiative the thrall's explode action needs to recharge before it can be used.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Explode {@recharge 5}
entries: The thrall explodes, instantly killing it. Each creature within 10 feet of the thrall must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, taking 13 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Floating
entries: The stinger cannot fly higher than 5 feet above the ground.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d6 - 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shocker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1d4}) lightning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 10} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition stunned} until the beginning of the stinger's next turn.

trait.name: Disease Carrier
entries: A sea maggot has a 25% chance of carrying a disease determined by the Dungeon Master.

trait.name: Gastropod
entries: The sea maggot ignores movement restrictions caused by diffifult terrain. Additionaly the sea maggot can climb difficult sufaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Shell
entries: As long as the sea maggot is not {@condition prone}, bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage that it takes from non-magical weapons is reduced by 2.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Brine
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the sea maggot that it can see, must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw, or suffers 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The uca can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uca makes two claw slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature it must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of the uca's next turn.

action.name: Claw Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pierce
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage. The creature is wounded. At the start of the wounded creature's turn, it takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage. It then makes a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, ending this effect on itself on a success. This effect also ends at the end of the wounded creature's turn when the creature has taken a total of 30 necrotic damage or more from this effect, or when a creature uses an action to make a successful {@dc 15} Wisdom (Medicine) check on the creature.

monster.name: Squiffy Ghast
languages: All languages it spoke in life

trait.name: Building Performance
entries: The squiffy ghast cannot use its offkilter jig action before one creature or more has failed its saving throw against its maddening shanty in the last minute.

trait.name: Fancy Footwork
entries: Opportunity attacks against the squiffy ghast have disadvantage.

action.name: Sabre
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Maddening Shanty
entries: A creature within 60 ft. of the squiffy ghast, that can hear it perform, must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) psychic damage and has its mind invaded by the squiffy ghast's shanty. As long as a creature is affected by the shanty, the creature has disadvantage on all Intelligence, Wisdom and Charisma saving throws, as well as Constitution saving throws to concentrate on spells. To end the effect of the shanty a creature must spend a minute in quiet meditation.

action.name: Offkilter Jig {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature within 20 ft. of the squiffy ghast that can hear it must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed check a creature begins dance to the music of the squiffy ghast for as long as it can hear the ghast's performance. A dancing creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage at the beginning of its turn and has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and attack rolls. A dancing creature must use all its movement to dance, causing it to move half of its movement into a random direction without provoking opportunity attacks. Attacks against a dancing creature are made with advantage. At the end of a dancing creature's turn, it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The siren can breathe air and water.

headerEntries: The siren's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 14}). The siren can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pressure Crash {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in a 10-foot radius sphere centered on a point within 60 feet of the siren must make a {@dc 14} Constitution save. A creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) thunder damage and 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Song of Desire
entries: Target humanoid creature within 60 ft of the siren, that can hear her, must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw, or is {@condition charmed} for 1 hour. The siren controls the actions of the {@condition charmed} creature for the duration of this effect. Each time the {@condition charmed} creature takes damage it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The effect also ends if the siren uses Song of Desire against another creature.

trait.name: "All Hands on Deck!"
entries: At the beginning of the crew's turn, the captain can ring his bell to summon one drowned puller. The crew cannot summon additional ones, until the summoned drowned puller is killed or dismissed as an action.

trait.name: Curse of the Ancestor
entries: The crew is bound by the Ancestor to the depths of the sea for eternity. The crew can by no means be removed out of the ocean by forced movement or teleportation of any kind. Only a wish spell can free the crew of this curse.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The crew has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crew's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 14}). The crew can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crew makes two boarding clutch attacks and casts a spell.

action.name: Boarding Clutch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Drink With The Dead {@recharge 4}
entries: The crew invites a creature within 60 feet of it to bouse alongside it. The creature must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save it suffers 22 ({@damage 4d10}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on all saving throws until the beginning of the crew's next turn. On a success it only suffers half as much damage and has no disadvantage on saving throws.

trait.name: Member of the Crew
entries: The drowned puller is aware of creatures that the crew that summoned it is aware of. If the drowned puller begins its turn further away from the crew than 60 ft., it takes 11 ({@damage 2d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Sadistic Restoration
entries: Whenever a creature fails its initial saving throw against the drowned puller's "Heave To!", the drowned puller is restored back to its full hit points.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The drowned puller has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: "Heave To!"
entries: The drowned puller throws its spectral anchor at a creature it can see within 30 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom throw or the be entrapped in an illusion of drowning. The character is {@condition paralyzed} and suffers 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage at the beginning of its turn. When the creature becomes unconcious, the drowned puller becomes {@condition incapacitated}, or the drowned puller starts its turn further than 30 ft. away from the creature, this effect ends. When the drowned puller suffers damage the first time in a turn, a creature under the effect of "Heave to!" can repeat the saving throw. On a successful saving throw the creature breaks through the illusion and the effect ends.

action.name: Boarding Clutch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}20 ({@damage 3d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Drink With The Dead {@recharge 4}
entries: The crew invites a creature within 60 feet of it to bouse alongside it. The creature must make a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save it suffers 44 ({@damage 8d10}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on all saving throws until the beginning of the crew's next turn. On a success it only suffers half as much damage and has no disadvantage on saving throws.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The crew and its summoned drowned ropeman move up to half of their speed.

legendary.name: Mutiny
entries: A creature within 60 ft. of the crw that can see and hear it must make a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save the creature is overcome doubt about its loyalty to its allies. It has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls and can't use the help action until the end of its next turn. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds the saving throw

legendary.name: Boarding Clutch (1/round)
entries: The crew attacks with its boarding clutch.

trait.name: Member of the Crew
entries: The drowned ropeman is aware of creatures that the crew that summoned it is aware of. If the drowned ropeman begins its turn further away from the crew than 60 ft., it takes 22 ({@damage 4d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Sadistic Restoration
entries: Whenever a creature fails its initial saving throw against the drowned ropeman's "Heave To!", the drowned ropeman is restored back to its full hit points.

action.name: "Heave To!"
entries: The drowned ropeman throws its spectral anchor at a creature it can see within 30 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom throw or the be entrapped in an illusion of drowning. The character is {@condition paralyzed} and suffers 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage at the beginning of its turn. When the creature becomes unconcious, the drowned ropeman becomes {@condition incapacitated}, or the drowned ropeman starts its turn further than 30 ft. away from the creature, this effect ends. When the drowned ropeman suffers damage the first time in a turn, a creature under the effect of "Heave to!" can repeat the saving throw. On a successful saving throw the creature breaks through the illusion and the effect ends.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The pelagic piranha can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Brute
entries: A melee weapon deals one extra die of its damage when the pelagic piranha hits with it.

trait.name: Harpoon Mastery
entries: The pelagic ignores disadvantage caused by long range and deals an additional dice of damage when throwing javelins, spears and harpoons (included in the attack)

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pelagic makes 2 melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Crude Scimitar
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Harpoon
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) piercing damage. If the target is a medium or smaller size creature, it must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw, or be pulled 10 feet towards the pelagic.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The pelagic champion can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Guard
entries: The pelagic can use a bonus action to protect one creature within 5 feet of itself. As long as the pelagic remains within 5 ft. of the creature, any attack that targets the chosen creature has disadvantage. The pelagic can only protect one creature at a time.

trait.name: Protective Reflexes
entries: The pelagic has an additional reaction per round which it can only use for its protect reaction.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The pelagic makes 2 melee weapon attacks.

action.name: Cestus
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) slashing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. Constructs, undead, and other creatures without blood succeed the saving throw automatically.

reaction.name: Protect
entries: When a creature within 5 feet of the pelagic attacks an ally under the effect of the pelagic's guard, the pelagic attacks the attacking creature with its cestus. To do so, the pelagic must see the attacker and the creature it guards.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The pelagic oracle can breathe air and water.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The pelagic is a 14th-level spellcaster. Its spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}, +7 to hit with spell attacks). The pelagic has the following spells prepared:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

trait.name: Slow Start
entries: When rolling initiative the thrall's explode action needs to recharge before it can be used.

trait.name: Gargling Grab
entries: A creature that starts its turn {@condition grappled} by the thrall, must succeed a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or becomes {@condition frightened} by the thrall until the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thrall makes two slam attacks.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage the thrall can choose to grapple the target instead, escape {@dc 14}.

action.name: Explode {@recharge 5}
entries: The thrall explodes, instantly killing it. Each creature within 10 feet of the thrall must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save or half as much on a successful one.

trait.name: Floating
entries: The stinger cannot fly higher than 5 feet above the ground.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The stinger makes two attacks. If two sting attacks hit the same creature, it must succeed on a {@dc 14} Constitution saving throw or takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage.

action.name: Sting
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Shocker
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 1} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) lightning damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 11} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition paralyzed} until the beginning of the stinger's next turn.

trait.name: Disease Carrier
entries: An armored maggot has a 25% chance of carrying a disease determined by the Dungeon Master.

trait.name: Gastropod
entries: The armored maggot ignores movement restrictions caused by diffifult terrain. Additionaly the plated maggot can climb difficult sufaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

trait.name: Shell
entries: As long as the armored maggot is not {@condition prone}, it has resistance to bludgeoning, piercing and slashing damage that it takes from non-magical weapons.

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}1 ({@damage 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Brine
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the armored maggot that it can see, must succeed on a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw, or suffers 10 ({@damage 3d6}) acid damage, has disadvantage on Dexterity saving throws and its speed is halved until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The uca can breathe air and water.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The uca makes two claw slam attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature it must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of the uca's next turn.

action.name: Claw Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Pierce
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 1d10 + 6}) piercing damage. The creature is wounded. At the start of the wounded creature's turn, it takes 20 ({@damage 8d4}) necrotic damage. It then makes a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, ending this effect on itself on a success. As long as a creature is wounded, any source of healing will heal the creature only half as much. This effect also ends at the end of the wounded creature's turn when the creature has taken a total of 60 necrotic damage or more from this effect, or when a creature uses an action to make a successful {@dc 18} Wisdom (Medicine) check on the creature.

trait.name: Amphibious
entries: The siren can breathe air and water.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the siren fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The siren's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 16}). The siren can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The siren makes two attacks with her claws.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 2d10 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Pressure Crash {@recharge 4}
entries: Each creature in a 10-footradius sphere centered on a point within 60 feet of the siren must make a {@dc 18} Constitution save. A creature takes 22 ({@damage 5d8}) thunder damage and 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.

action.name: Song of Desire
entries: Target creature within 60 ft of the siren, that can hear her, must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, or is {@condition charmed} for 1 hour. The siren controls the actions of the {@condition charmed} creature for the duration of this effect. Each time the {@condition charmed} creature takes damage it can repeat the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. The effect also ends if the siren uses Song of Desire against another creature.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The siren, or a creature charmed by her Song of desire, moves up to half their speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The siren makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Attack (2/Round)
entries: The siren attacks with her claws or a creature charmed by her Song of Desire makes a melee or ranged weapon attack

legendary.name: Devour (2 Actions)
entries: The siren manifests lashing tentacles in a 15-foot cone originating from her. Each creature in that area must succeed on a DC 16 Dexterity saving throw or take 15 ({@damage 6d4}) piercing damage.

trait.name: "All Hands On Deck!"
entries: At the beginning of the crew's turn, the captain can ring his bell to summon one drowned anchorman. The crew cannot summon additional ones, until the summoned drowned anchorman is killed or dismissed as an action.

trait.name: Curse of the Ancestor
entries: The crew is bound by the Ancestor to the depths of the sea for eternity. The crew can by no means be removed out of the ocean by forced movement or teleportation of any kind. Only a wish spell can free the crew of this curse.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the crew fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Turn Immunity
entries: The crew is immune to effects that turn undead.

spellcasting.name: Innate Spellcasting
headerEntries: The crew's spellcasting ability is Wisdom (spell save {@dc 15}). The crew can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The crew makes two boarding clutch attacks and casts a spell.

action.name: Boarding Clutch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}21 ({@damage 3d10 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Drink With The Dead {@recharge 4}
entries: The crew invites a creature within 60 feet of it to bouse alongside it. The creature must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save it suffers 66 ({@damage 12d10}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on all saving throws for one minute. On a success it only suffers half as much damage and has no disadvantage on saving throws. A creature under this effect repeats the saving throw at the end of its turns, ending the effect on a success

legendary.name: Move
entries: The crew and its summoned drowned anchorman move up to half of their speed.

legendary.name: Mutiny
entries: A creature within 60 ft. of the crw that can see and hear it must make a {@dc 18} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save the creature is overcome doubt about its loyalty to its allies. It has disadvantage on ability checks and attack rolls and can't use the help action until the end of its next turn. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds the saving throw

legendary.name: Boarding Clutch (2/Round)
entries: The crew attacks with its boarding clutch.

legendary.name: "Heave To!" (2 Actions)
entries: The crew's summoned drowned anchorman uses "Heave To!".

trait.name: Member of the Crew
entries: The drowned anchorman is aware of creatures that the crew that summoned it is aware of. If the drowned anchorman begins its turn further away from the crew than 60 ft., it takes 33 ({@damage 6d10}) force damage.

trait.name: Sadistic Restoration
entries: Whenever a creature fails its initial saving throw against the drowned anchorman's "Heave To!", the drowned anchorman is restored back to its full hit points.

trait.name: Turn Resistance
entries: The drowned anchorman has advantage on saving throws against any effect that turns undead.

action.name: "Heave To!"
entries: The drowned anchorman throws its spectral anchor at a creature it can see within 30 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 18} Wisdom throw or the be entrapped in an illusion of drowning. The character is {@condition paralyzed} and suffers 22 ({@damage 5d8}) psychic damage at the beginning of its turn. When the creature becomes unconcious, the drowned anchorman becomes {@condition incapacitated}, or the drowned anchorman starts its turn further than 30 ft. away from the creature, this effect ends. When the drowned anchorman suffers damage the first time in a turn, a creature under the effect of "Heave to!" can repeat the saving throw. On a successful saving throw the creature breaks through the illusion and the effect ends.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The supplicant has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Gather the Blood
entries: As a Bonus Action, the Supplicant can dash towards a hostile creature that it can smell.

trait.name: Resilient Body
entries: The Supplicant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition stunned} and being {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage.

action.name: Predigestion
entries: One creature within 60 feet of the Supplicant must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage and 3 ({@damage 1d6}) acid damage at the end of its next turn unless the creature uses an action to wash off the acid.

trait.name: Bloodlust
entries: The Sycophant starts out in its basic form. When the Sycophant enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Sycophant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Sycophant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Flyby (Bloodlust)
entries: The sycophant doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d4 + 2}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points.

action.name: Whine (Base Form)
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: White (Bloodlust Form)
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 11} Wisdom saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage and can't use bonus actions or reactions until the end of its next turn. A creature that is immune to psychic damage succeeds the save automatically

action.name: Bombing Run {@recharge 4}
entries: The Sycophant is raining down deadly spines within an area. Each creature in a 15-foot square based on a point within 30 feet of the Sycophant must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) piercing damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The chevalier has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Piercing Claws
entries: The chevalier's claws and skewers are able to penetrate up to 5 ft. of stone or 10 ft. of wood.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chevalier makes two attacks with its claws or subterran skewers.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Subterran Skewers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d10 + 3}) piercing damage. This attack is made with disadvantage if the target is within 5 ft. of the Chevalier.

action.name: Buried Blast {@recharge}
entries: The Chevalier causes a 15-foot cube blast on a point within 30 ft. of itself. Each creature in the blast must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of the chevalier's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition prone}. The ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Clearing the area by hand requires 1 minute of work per 5-foot square.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Manservant starts out in its base form. When the Manservant enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Manservant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Manservant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d4 + 1}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 2d4 + 1}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points.

action.name: Cleaver (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}4 ({@damage 1d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Cleaver (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d6 + 1}) slashing damage.

action.name: Enraging Sight
entries: A creature within 60 feet that can see the Manservant must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or take 3 ({@damage 1d6}) psychic damage and the creature's next attack roll before the end of its turn has disadvantage if it does not target the Manservant. Additionally on a failed saving throw, if the Manservant is in its Bloodlust form the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of the Manservant's next turn.

reaction.name: Infallible Servitude
entries: When a creature the Manservant can see attacks an ally that is within 5 feet of the Manservant, it uses a reaction to become the new target of the attack instead.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Esquire starts out in its base form. When the Esquire enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Esquire has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Esquire entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack (Base Form)
entries: The Esquire makes two Rapier attacks, or one attack with its Rapier and one with its Flintlock Pistol.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage and the Esquire recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points and, if the Esquire is in its base form, enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Rapier (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flintlock Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodlust Form)
entries: The Esquire makes two pierce attacks, or one pierce attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Pierce (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d10 + 2}) piercing damage. The Esquire's next attack against the target has advantage until the end of the Esquire's turn.

action.name: Claws (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d10 + 2}) slashing damage. This attack is made with advantage if the Esquire moved 20 or more feet in a straight line right before making this attack.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Courtesan starts out in its base form. When the Courtesan enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Courtesan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Courtesan entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Bloodsated Fury
entries: When the Courtesan transforms into her Bloodlust form during her turn through her bite, she can make one claw attack as a bonus action until the end of her turn.

trait.name: Moonlight Inspiration (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan can use a bonus action to inspire an allied bloodsucker that can hear it. The bloodsucker can add {@dice 1d6} to any attack roll, skill check, or saving throw until the beginning of the Courtesan's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan makes two slam attacks and uses Damsel in Distress.

action.name: Slam (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) bludgeoning damage. The target cannot make opportunity attacks against the Courtesan until the beginning of the Courtesan's next turn.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the Courtesan recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Damsel in Distress (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan takes cover behind a chosen allied creature within 5 ft. of herself. Attacks made against the Courtesan are made with disadvantage until the end of the Courtesan's next turn, as long as it remains within 5 ft. of the chosen creature.

action.name: Careless Whispers (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan whispers magical words of deceit in a 60-foot cone. Each creature of the Courtesan's choice that can hear her in the cone must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodlust Form)
entries: The Courtesan makes two claw attacks and one bite attack; or makes two predigestion attacks.

action.name: Claw (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the Courtesan recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points. Additionally, the Courtesan has advantage on all attack rolls against the creature until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Predigestion (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 5} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage and takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Apex Predator
entries: Any hit by a bite attack the Crocodilian scores against a target, that is surprised or unable to see it, is a critical hit.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodilian can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Marsh Prowler
entries: The Crocodilian has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when it hides in murky or swampy waters.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or is {@condition grappled} by the Crocodilian, escape {@dc 15}. Until the grapple ends, the Crocodilian can't bite another target.

action.name: Swarming Corruption {@recharge 4}
entries: The Crocodilian unleashes its a parasitic swarm of mosquitos that fills a 20-foot-radius around the Crocodilian. Every creature except for the Crocodilian in the area must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) piercing damage and on a successful saving throw only half as much. Additionaly until the beginning of the Crocodilian's next turn the area is heavily obscured by the swarming mosquitos.

action.name: Submerge (1/Short Rest)
entries: Can only be used when the Crocodilian is within a body of water. It hides and regains 13 ({@dice 3d8}) hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the baron fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: When the Baron attacks a creature with an attack, he does not provoke opportunity attacks from that creature until the beginning of his next turn.

trait.name: Spider Climb
entries: The the baron can climb difficult surfaces, including upside down on ceilings, without needing to make an ability check.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Baron makes two tentacle attacks. If both attacks hit the same creature, the target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or is pushed or pulled 5 ft. in a direction of the Baron's choice.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d12 + 4}) piercing damage and the Baron heals for 10 ({@dice 3d6}) hit points.

action.name: Crowd Pleaser {@recharge 5}
entries: Each creature in a 10-foot wide, 30 ft. long line from the Baron must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw, taking 35 ({@damage 10d6}) piercing damage on a failed save, and half as much on a successful one. Creatures further away than 15 ft. from the Baron take half as much damage from this action.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Baron moves up to his speed.

legendary.name: Forced Enthusiasm
entries: The Baron makes a tentacle attack against an ally within reach. On a hit the ally gains +10 movement speed and advantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn. An ally can benefit from this action only once per minute.

legendary.name: Bite (2 Actions)
entries: The Baron makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Necessary Discipline (3 Actions)
entries: The Baron makes two tentacle attacks against a target in reach. If both attacks hit the target must succeed on a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or is {@condition frightened} until the end of the Baron's next turn.

trait.name: Cruel Cutlery
entries: If two cutlery attacks hit the same creature in one turn, it suffers a wound for one minute. A wounded creature suffers 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage at the start of its turn for each wound and then makes a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all wounds on a success. Alternatively a creature can use an action to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check or spend one charge of a healer's kit to close all wounds on the creature and end the effect. A creature can have more than one wound.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The the viscount has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the viscount fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Revolting Palette
entries: The Viscount has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition poisoned} and can consume spoiled food.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Viscount uses Hungry Eyes and makes two cutlery attacks. The Viscount can make a skewer attack in place of two cutlery attacks.

action.name: Cutlery
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: Skewer
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If the creature is of large size or smaller, the creature must succeed a {@dc 20} Strength saving throw. On a failed save the Baron can either push the creature 10 ft. away from himself, or grapple the creature, escape {@dc 20}. Until the grapple ends, the creature is {@condition restrained} and the Baron cannot use its skewer attack.

action.name: Hungry Eyes
entries: The Viscount works up its appetite for a creature he can see within 60 ft. of himself. Any time Viscount makes an attack against the creature until the beginning of his next turn, he adds {@dice 1d6} to his attack roll. Additionally, as long as the Viscount can smell the creature, he knows its exact location as if he can see it until the beginning of his next turn.

reaction.name: It Bites Back
entries: When a creature under the effect of his Hungry Eyes attacks the Viscount, he makes a cutlery attack against the triggering creature.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Baron moves up to half of his speed.

legendary.name: Salavating (1/Round)
entries: The Viscount's appetite becomes tangible and unnerving. Any creature under the effect of the Viscount's Hungry Eyes must succeed a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw, or takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition frightened} until the end of the Viscounts next turn.

legendary.name: Cutlery (2 Actions)
entries: The Viscount makes a cutlery attack.

legendary.name: Feast (3 Actions)
entries: The Viscount makes two cutlery attacks against a creature {@condition restrained} by its skewers. For each attack that hits, the Viscount regains 10 ({@dice 4d4}) hit points.

trait.name: Flushed
entries: The Countess starts in her base form and cannot transform into her bloodlust form during the first round of combat after rolling initiative (or otherwise agitated). Once the Countess transforms back into her base form, she cannot transform back into her bloodlust form until the end of her next turn.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The the countess has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Mood Swing {@recharge 5}
entries: At the beginning of her turn the Countess transforms into her bloodlust form. She has unique actions in this form and gains a +2 bonus to attack and damage rolls (included in her attacks). At the beginning of her next turn, she transforms back into her base form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the countess fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

action.name: Multiattack (Base Only)
entries: The Countess makes three attacks; two attacks with her claws and one infestation attack.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Infestation (Base Only)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d4 + 7}) piercing damage. The target becomes infested with a parasitic egg that gestates within the creature until it hatches. At the end of an infested creature's turn, it must succeed a {@dc 22} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the parasite hatches and explodes out of the creature, dealing 18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage to the creature and the Countess gains temporary hit points equal to the necrotic damage dealt. When the creature succeeds the saving throw the DC of the saving throw is increased by 2. An infested creature only carry one parasitic egg at a time.

action.name: Hypnotic Sway (Base Only)
entries: The Countess sways to magically charm her foes. Each creature within 40 ft. that can see her must succeed a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or be swayed for one minute. A swayed creature and begins to unvoluntarily move in the rythm of the Countess' swaying hips and has disadvantage on attack rolls againsth the Countess. At the beginning of a swayed creature's turn it takes 15 ({@damage 6d4}) psychic damage and moves up to their speed in a randomly determined direction (roll {@dice 1d8} to determined where). A swayed creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. A creature that is immune to being {@condition charmed} automatically succeeds the saving throw. Once a creature succeeds the saving throw or the effect ends on it, it becomes immune to the Countess' Hypnotic Sway for 24 hours.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodlust Only)
entries: The Countess makes three attacks; two attacks with her claws and one bite attack.

action.name: Claws (Bloodlust)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d6 + 7}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}23 ({@damage 3d10 + 7}) piercing damage and the Countess regains 13 ({@dice 3d8}) hit points.

action.name: Screams of Ecstasy (Bloodlust Only)
entries: The Countess screams at a creature within 60 ft. of herself that can hear her. The target creature and each creature within 5 ft. of it must make a {@dc 23} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) thunder damage is {@condition stunned} until the end of the Countess' next turn. A {@condition stunned} creature is {@condition deafened}. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition stunned}.

action.name: Lashing Tongue (Bloodlust Only)
entries: The Countess attacks with her lashing tongue. Each creature in a 30 ft. long and 5 ft. wide line originating from the Countess must make a {@dc 23} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) piercing damage and is wounded. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not wounded. A wounded creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage at the beginning of its turn for each time it has been wounded, at the end of its turn it makes a {@dc 21} Constituton saving throw, ending the effect of all wounds on itself on a success. Alternatively a creature can use an action to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check or spend one charge of a healer's kit to close all wounds on the creature and end the effect. A creature can have more than one wound.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Countess moves up to half of her speed without provoking opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Wink (Base Only)
entries: The Countess winks at a creature that can see her. The creature must succeed a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw or has disadvantage on all attacks targeting the Countess until the end of her next turn or until the Countess transforms.

legendary.name: Disrobe
entries: The Countess attacks with her claws.

legendary.name: Screech (1/Round)
entries: The Countess uses her Scream of Ecstasy.

legendary.name: Kiss (2 Actions) (Base Only)
entries: The Countess makes an Infestation attack.

legendary.name: Bite (2 Actions) (Bloodthirst)
entries: The Countess makes a bite attack.

resist.note: from nonmagical attacks not made with adamantine weapons

trait.name: Hatred Beyond Time
entries: When the Garden Guardian's shield is destroyed or otherwise removed from combat, the Garden Guardian's Annihilating Glare attack loses its recharge property.

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The garden guardian is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the garden guardian fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The garden guardian has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The garden guardian's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Stone Armament
entries: The Garden Guardian carries a shield and a spear. Each of which are large objects that are controlled by the Garden Guardian as long as they are within 240 ft. of it. Each of them have an AC of 18, 100 hit points and are immune to poison and psychic damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Garden Guardian uses its Annihilating Glare if available and uses its Command Shield or its Command Spear.

action.name: Annihilating Glare {@recharge}
entries: The Garden Guardian fires a wide ray of corruptive energy in a 60 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw, taking 45 ({@damage 10d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Command Shield
entries: The Garden Guardian moves its shield up to 60 ft. and does one of the following;
• Aegis. As long as the shield is within 5 ft. of the Garden Guardian, any attack targeting the Garden Guardian is redirected at the shield instead.

• Plummet. The shield is flung up into the air and lands at a point within 60 ft. of the shield's initial position. Once the shield reaches its destination or impacts against a solid surface, each creature and object within 10 ft. of the point of impact must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 4d10}) bludgeoning damage. A creature that fails the saving by 5 or more is {@condition stunned} until the end of the Garden Guardian's next turn.

action.name: Command Spear
entries: Command Spear. The Garden Guardian moves its spear up to 30 ft. and makes two of the following attacks with the spear;
• Impale. Melee Weapon Attack: {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}25 ({@damage 3d12 + 6}) piercing damage.

• Feed the Soil. Ranged Spell Attack: {@hit 11} to hit, range 120 ft., one creature. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d8}) necrotic damage and the creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage at the beginning of its next turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Garden Guardian makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Coordinate
entries: The Garden Guardian moves up to half of its speed and its shield and spear move up to 15 ft..

legendary.name: Command (2 Actions)
entries: The Garden Guardian uses its Command Shield or Command Spear. It can only command an item the Garden Guardian did not command since the start of its last turn.

legendary.name: Focus Hate (3 Actions)
entries: The DC of the Garden Guardian's next Annihilating Glare is increased by 2 (20). The Garden Guardian can only use this action when its shield is destroyed.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The supplicant (veteran) has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Gather the Blood
entries: As a Bonus Action, the Supplicant can dash towards a hostile creature that it can smell.

trait.name: Resilient Body
entries: The Supplicant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition stunned} and being {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Supplicant makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) piercing damage.

action.name: Predigestion
entries: One creature within 60 feet of the Supplicant must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage and 5 ({@damage 2d4}) acid damage at the end of its next turn, unless the creature uses an action to wash off the acid.

trait.name: Bloodlust
entries: The Sycophant starts out in its basic form. When the Sycophant enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Sycophant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Sycophant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Flyby (Bloodlust Only)
entries: The sycophant (veteran) doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d4 + 4}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Whine
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Whine (Bloodlust Form)
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and can't use bonus actions or reactions until the end of its next turn. A creature that is immune to psychic damage succeeds the save automatically.

action.name: Bombing Run {@recharge 4}
entries: The Sycophant is raining down deadly spines within an area. Each creature in a 15-foot square based on a point within 30 feet of the Sycophant must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) piercing damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Manservant starts out in its basic Thirst form. When the Manservant enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Manservant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Manservant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Manservant makes two attacks with its cleaver.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Cleaver (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points.

action.name: Cleaver (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) slashing damage.

action.name: Enraging Slight
entries: A creature within 60 feet that can see the Manservant must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and the creature's next attack roll before the end of its turn has disadvantage if it does not target the Manservant. Additionally on a failed saving throw, if the Manservant is in its Bloodlust form the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of the Manservant's next turn.

reaction.name: Infallible Servitude
entries: When a creature the Manservant can see attacks an ally that is within 5 feet of the Manservant, it uses a reaction to become the new target of the attack instead.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Esquire starts out in its base form. When the Esquire enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Esquire has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Esquire entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Precision Attack
entries: The first time in a turn the Esquire hits a creature with an attack made with advantage, it deals an additional 7 ({@damage 2d6}) damage.

trait.name: Suave Defense
entries: The Esquire adds its Charisma modifier to its Armor Class if it wears light or no armor and wields no shield.

action.name: Multiattack (Base Form)
entries: The Esquire makes two Rapier attacks, or one attack with its Rapier and one with its Flintlock Pistol.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage and the Esquire recovers 5 ({@dice 2d4}) hit points and if the Esquire is in its base form it enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Rapier (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Flintlock Pistol
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit +5} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodlust Form)
entries: The Esquire makes two pierce attacks, or one pierce attack and one bite attack.

action.name: Pierce (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) piercing damage. The Esquire's next attack against the target has advantage until the end of the Esquire's turn.

action.name: Claws (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d10 + 3}) slashing damage. This attack is made with advantage if the Esquire moved 20 or more feet in a straight line right before making this attack.

trait.name: Apex Predator
entries: Any hit by a bite attack the Crocodilian scores against a target, that is surprised or unable to see it, is a critical hit.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodilian (veteran) can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the crocodilian (veteran) fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Marsh Prowler
entries: The Crocodilian has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when it hides in murky or swampy waters.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 3d12 + 5}) piercing damage. The target must succeed on a {@dc 17} Strength saving throw or is {@condition grappled} by the Crocodilian, escape {@dc 17}. Until the grapple ends, the Crocodilian can't bite another target.

action.name: Swarming Corruption {@recharge 4}
entries: The Crocodilian unleashes its a parasitic swarm of mosquitos that fills a 20-foot-radius around the Crocodilian. Every creature except for the Crocodilian in the area must make a {@dc 16} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 18 ({@damage 4d8}) piercing damage and on a successful saving throw only half as much. Additionaly until the beginning of the Crocodilian's next turn the area is heavily obscured by the swarming mosquitos.

action.name: Submerge (1/Short Rest)
entries: Can only be used when the Crocodilian is within a body of water. It hides and regains 27 ({@dice 6d8}) hit points.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Crocodilian makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Crocodilian moves up to half of its movement speed. The Crocodilian's movement using its swim speed provokes no opportunity attacks

legendary.name: Bite (2 Actions)
entries: The Crocodilian makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Hide (2 Actions)
entries: The Crocodilian hides. The Crocodilian can use this action only when it is within a body of water.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The supplicant (champion) has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Gather the Blood
entries: As a Bonus Action, the Supplicant can dash towards a hostile creature that it can smell.

trait.name: Resilient Body
entries: The Supplicant has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition stunned} and being {@condition paralyzed}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Supplicant makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Predigestion
entries: One creature within 60 feet of the Supplicant must succeed on a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage and 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage at the end of its next turn.

When in Bloodlust form the Sycophant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Sycophant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Flyby
entries: The sycophant (champion) doesn't provoke opportunity attacks when it flies out of an enemy's reach.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d4 + 5}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 3 ({@dice 1d6}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d4 + 5}) piercing damage and the Sycophant recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Whine
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage.

action.name: Whine (Bloodlust Form)
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the Sycophant, must succeed on a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 10 ({@damage 3d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the Sycophant's next turn. A creature that is immune to psychic damage succeeds the save automatically.

action.name: Bombing Run (Bloodlust Form Only) {@recharge 4}
entries: The Sycophant is raining down deadly spines within an area. Each creature in a 15-foot square based on a point within 30 feet of the Sycophant must make a {@dc 15} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure a creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage. On a successful save, a creature takes half as much damage.

trait.name: Keen Smell
entries: The chevalier (champion) has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on smell.

trait.name: Piercing Claws
entries: The chevalier's claws and skewers are able to penetrate up to 5 ft. of stone or 10 ft. of wood.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The chevalier makes two attacks with its claws or subterran skewers.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

action.name: Subterran Skewers
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 2d12 + 5}) piercing damage. This attack is made with disadvantage if the target is within 5 ft. of the Chevalier.

action.name: Buried Blast {@recharge}
entries: The Chevalier causes a 15-foot cube blast on a point within 30 ft. of itself. Each creature in the blast must make a {@dc 14} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 27 ({@damage 6d8}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone} and {@condition stunned} until the end of the chevalier's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition prone} or {@condition stunned}. The ground in that area becomes difficult terrain until cleared. Clearing the area by hand requires 1 minute of work per 5-foot square.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Manservant starts out in its basic Thirst form. When the Manservant enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Manservant has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Manservant entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Manservant makes three attacks; two with its cleaver and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Cleaver (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}11 ({@damage 2d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the Manservant recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points.

action.name: Cleaver (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Enraging Sight
entries: A creature within 60 feet that can see the Manservant must succeed on a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw or take 14 ({@damage 4d6}) psychic damage and the creature's next attack roll before the end of its turn has disadvantage if it does not target the Manservant. Additionally on a failed saving throw, if the Manservant is in its Bloodlust form the creature is {@condition frightened} until the end of the Manservant's next turn.

reaction.name: Infallible Servitude
entries: When a creature the Manservant can see attacks an ally that is within 5 feet of the Manservant, it uses a reaction to become the new target of the attack instead.

trait.name: The Thirst
entries: The Courtesan starts out in its base form. When the Courtesan enters its Bloodlust form it gains access to new Actions. When in Bloodlust form the Courtesan has advantage on Wisdom (Perception) checks that rely on smell. Once the Courtesan entered its Bloodlust form it remains in it until it finishes a short rest.

trait.name: Bloodsated Fury
entries: When the Courtesan transforms into her Bloodlust form during her turn through her bite, she can make one claw attack as a bonus action until the end of her turn.

trait.name: Moonlight Inspiration (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan can use a bonus action to inspire an allied bloodsucker that can hear it. The bloodsucker can add {@dice 1d10} to any attack roll, skill check, or saving throw until the beginning of the Courtesan's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan makes two slam attacks and uses Damsel in Distress.

action.name: Slam (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d8 + 4}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bite (Base Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 1d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the Courtesan recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points and enters its Bloodlust Form.

action.name: Damsel in Distress (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan takes cover behind a chosen allied creature within 5 ft. of herself. Attacks made against the Courtesan are made with disadvantage until the end of the Courtesan's next turn, as long as it remains within 5 ft. of the chosen creature.

action.name: Careless Whispers (Base Form)
entries: The Courtesan whispers magical words of deceit in a 60-foot cone. Each creature of the Courtesan's choice that can hear her in the cone must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save creature takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) psychic damage and has disadvantage on the next attack roll it makes before the end of its next turn.

action.name: Multiattack (Bloodlust Form)
entries: The Courtesan makes two claw attacks and one bite attack; or makes two predigestion attacks.

action.name: Claw (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 3d8 + 4}) slashing damage.

action.name: Bite (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 3d6 + 4}) piercing damage and the Courtesan recovers 7 ({@dice 2d6}) hit points. Additionally, the Courtesan has advantage on all attack rolls against the creature until the end of its next turn.

action.name: Predigestion (Bloodlust Form)
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 4d4 + 4}) acid damage and takes 10 ({@damage 4d4}) acid damage at the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Apex Predator
entries: Any hit by a bite attack the Crocodilian scores against a target, that is surprised or unable to see it, is a critical hit.

trait.name: Hold Breath
entries: The crocodilian (champion) can hold its breath for 1 hour.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the crocodilian (champion) fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Marsh Prowler
entries: The Crocodilian has advantage on Dexterity (Stealth) checks when it hides in murky or swampy waters.

entries: The Crocodilian makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}32 ({@damage 4d12 + 6}) piercing damage. If the target is size Medium or smaller, it is {@condition grappled} by the Crocodilian, escape {@dc 18}. Until the grapple ends, the target is {@condition restrained} and the Crocodilian can't bite another target.

action.name: Swarming Corruption {@recharge 4}
entries: The Crocodilian unleashes its a parasitic swarm of mosquitos that fills a 20-foot-radius around the Crocodilian. Every creature except for the Crocodilian in the area must make a {@dc 17} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) piercing damage and on a successful saving throw only half as much. Additionaly the area remains filled with a buzzing swarm of mosquitos until the end of the Crocodilian's next turn. As long as the insects remain, the area is heavily obscured and creatures within the area are {@condition blinded}.

action.name: Submerge (1/Short Rest)
entries: Can only be used when the Crocodilian is within a body of water. It hides and regains 36 ({@dice 8d8}) hit points.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Crocodilian makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Crocodilian moves up to half of its movement speed. The Crocodilian's movement using its swim speed provokes no opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Bite (2 Actions)
entries: The Crocodilian makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Hide (2 Actions)
entries: The Crocodilian hides. The Crocodilian can use this action only when it is within a body of water.

trait.name: Invigorating Fluids
entries: When a creature destroys a crystaline aberration with a melee attack, it regains 2 ({@dice 1d4}) hit points.

action.name: Resonance
entries: A creature within 30 feet of the crystaline abomination must succeed on a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw, or take 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of its next turn. The crystaline aberration is destroyed at the end of its turn.

action.name: Explosive Undoing
entries: The crystaline aberration explodes, destroying itself. Any creature in a 20-foot radius of the crystaline abomination must make a {@dc 12} Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw a creature takes 5 ({@damage 2d4}) piercing damage, or half as much damage on a successful one.

trait.name: Crystaline Growth
entries: After the farmhand dies, a crystaline aberration grows out of its body the following round on the farmhand's initiative. Any damage dealt to the farmhand's body destroys it completely, causing no crystaline aberration to spawn.

action.name: Hoe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 3} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d8 + 1}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Irradiated Seeds
entries: The farmhand throws irradiated seeds at creature within 15 feet of itself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 11} Dexterity saving throw or is covered in irradiated seeds and takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) radiant damage at the beginning of each of its turns for one minute or until the target creature or a creature within 5 feet of it takes an action to remove the seeds.

action.name: Pause from Labor (1/Short Rest)
entries: The farmhand regains 9 ({@dice 2d8}) hit points.

trait.name: Crystalline Growth
entries: After the foreman dies, a crystaline aberration grows out of its body the following round on the foreman's initiative. Any damage dealt to the foreman's body destroys it completely, causing no crystaline aberration to spawn.

action.name: Whip
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit +4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}7 ({@damage 2d4 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Stir the Rabble {@recharge 5}
entries: The foreman chooses up to 4 allied farmhands that it can see within 30 feet of itself. The farmhands have advantage on weapon attacks attacks and the DC of their irradiated seeds becomes 13 until the end of the foreman's next turn.

reaction.name: No Trespassers
entries: The foreman makes a whip attack against a creature that enters the foreman's reach. If the attack hits, the next attack made by an ally of the foreman before the end of the foreman's next turn against the creature has advantage.

trait.name: Crystalline Growth
entries: After the scarecrow dies, a crystaline aberration grows out of its body the following round on the scarecrow's initiative. Any damage dealt to the scarecrow's body destroys it completely, causing no crystaline aberration to spawn.

trait.name: False Appearance
entries: While the scarecrow remains motionless, it is indistinguishable from an ordinary, inanimate scarecrow. Using its haunting revelations does not break the scarecrows disguise.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}6 ({@damage 1d8 + 2}) slashing damage.

action.name: Haunting Revelation (1/Day)
entries: The scarecrow penetrates the mind of a creature within 30 feet, filling it with eldritch knowledge beyond its comprehension for one minute. At the start of each of the creature's turns, it must make a {@dc 12} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature is {@condition incapacitated} and takes 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage. On a successful save, the creature takes no damage and the effect ends.

trait.name: Crystalline Growth
entries: After the plow horse dies, a crystaline aberration grows out of its body the following round on the plow horses initiative. Any damage dealt to the plow horse's body destroys it completely, causing no crystaline aberration to spawn.

action.name: Hooves
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 1d10 + 3}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Dust Cloud
entries: The plow horse kicks up a 10 ft. sphere cloud of dust centered on itself, provided the plow horse currently stands on dirt or sand. The dust cloud is dense enough to provide 3/4 cover to any creature standing inside or behind it, unless the attacker is within 5 ft. of the creature. The dust cloud remains until the end of the plow horse's next turn.

action.name: Trample {@recharge 5}
entries: The plow horse charges 20 to 50 feet in a straight line, passing through spaces of any creature of medium size or smaller. This movement does not provoke attack of opportunities. Any creature the plow horse moves through must make a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw. On a failure the creature takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) bludgeoning damage and be knocked {@condition prone}. On a successful save the creature only takes half damage and be not knocked {@condition prone}.

trait.name: Reverb
entries: The first time in a turn when a creature attacks and deals damage to the herald, the creature must succeed a {@dc 12} Constitution saving throw or takes 3 ({@damage 1d6}) thunder damage.

action.name: Reality Bend
entries: {@atk ms,rs} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft. or unlimited range, one target. {@h}2 ({@damage 1d4}) psychic damage and the creature has disadvantage on all attack rolls until the end of its next turn.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The thing's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The thing uses shard and makes one bite attack and one vorpal strike.

action.name: Phase Gnaw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d4 + 4}) piercing damage. The damage of this attack cannot be resisted or reduced.

action.name: Vorpal Strike
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 2d8 + 4}) slashing damage. This attack scores a critical hit if the thing rolls a 19 or higher on the attack roll.

action.name: Vorpal Strike
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 4} to hit, range 30/60 ft., one target. {@h} The creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or is affected by one of the following effects, randomly determined by a {@dice 1d6} roll: 1-2: The creature is {@condition stunned} until the end of the thing's next turn. 3-4: The creature is {@condition blinded} until the end of the thing's next turn. 5-6: The creature has disadvantage on dexterity saving throws and it's movement speed is reduced to 0 until the end of the thing's next turn.

legendary.name: Return to the Stars
entries: The thing summons one Crystalline Aberration within 5 feet of itself and loses 5 hit points. If it is under any effects that causes it to repeat a saving throw at the end of its turn, it repeats said saving throw.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (2/Day)
entries: If the the miller fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Time Loop
entries: Every day at dawn the Miller is returned to the farmstead and is fully restored, ending all lasting effects suffered from the previous day, even if he was destroyed. He does not retain memories from the previous day

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Miller uses winter's breath and makes two giant scythe attacks.

action.name: Giant Scythe
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}16 ({@damage 3d6 + 6}) slashing damage.

action.name: The Reaping {@recharge 4}
entries: The Miller moves up to its speed and makes a Giant Scythe attack against up to 4 creatures it passes. This movement does not provoke opportunity attacks.

action.name: Winter's Breath
entries: The Miller transforms a farmhand within 20 ft. of itself into a frozen farmhand. A transformed farmhand becomes {@condition restrained} by ice until it is destroyed. As long as it is frozen it can only use the following new actions:

Hollow Keening. A creature within 30 ft. of the frozen farmhand that can hear it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage is {@condition frightened} for one minute. A {@condition frightened} creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the end of its turn and must repeat the saving throw. On a successful save the creature is no longer {@condition frightened}.
Thawing Soils. The frozen farmhand thaws and is no longer {@condition restrained}. It transforms back into a farmhand.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The Miller makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Miller moves up to half of his speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: The Master Becons (1/round)
entries: The Miller summons a random husk within 20 ft. of himself determined by a {@dice 1d6} roll.
1-2. Scarecrow (Veteran)
3-4. Farmhand (Veteran)
5-6. Sleeper's Herald (Veteran)

legendary.name: Reap (2 Actions)
entries: The Miller attacks with his giant scythe.

trait.name: Constructing Carapace
entries: At the beginning of its turn, when the Sleeper has at least 1 hit point, it gains 20 temporary hit points.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the sleeper fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Psionic Feedback
entries: Any creature that attempts to read the Sleeper's mind or invade its dream takes 42 ({@damage 12d6}) psychic damage and is {@condition stunned} for one minute.

trait.name: Telekinesis
entries: Even with most of its consciousness in deep slumber, the Sleeper can interact with the world around it. The Sleeper can move or manipulate creatures or objects as if under the effect of the Telekinesis spell.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Sleeper uses Maddening Presence and makes three tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacles
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 15 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Maddening Presence
entries: Each creature of the Sleeper's choice that is within 120 feet of the Sleeper and can see it must succeed on a {@dc 17} Wisdom saving throw or become {@condition frightened} for 1 minute. A creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the effect on itself on a success, and taking 5 psychic damage on a failure. If a creature's saving throw is successful or the effect ends for it, the creature is immune to the Sleeper's Maddening Presence for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Stirring {@recharge 5}
entries: The Sleeper stirs in its sleep and devastates the minds of any sentient creature within 120 ft. of itself. Each creature in the area with an intelligence score higher than 2 must make a {@dc 22} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 88 ({@damage 16d10}) psychic damage and half as much on a successful save. A creature that fails the saving throw while being {@condition frightened} by the Sleeper's maddening presence becomes {@condition stunned} until the end of the Sleeper's next turn.

action.name: Awakening {@recharge 4}
entries: The Sleeper makes six tentacle attacks, it can target no single creature with more than three tentacle attacks.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The Sleeper moves up to half of its speed.

legendary.name: Tentacle (2 Actions)
entries: The Sleeper makes a tentacle attack.

legendary.name: Telekinesis (2 Actions)
entries: The Sleeper uses its Telekinesis. The Sleeper must use 2 legendary actions at the end of its turn to maintain the grip on a {@condition restrained} creature

legendary.name: Rouse (3 Actions)
entries: The Sleeper rolls to recharge one of its used attacks.
