On a failed save the creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage is {@condition frightened} for one minute. A {@condition frightened} creature takes 7 ({@damage 2d6}) psychic damage at the end of its turn and must repeat the saving throw. On a successful save the creature is no longer {@condition frightened}.
Thawing Soils. The frozen farmhand thaws and is no longer {@condition restrained}. It transforms back into a farmhand.

• A creature within 20 ft. of the Miller must succeed on a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save the creature becomes {@condition restrained} for one minute. The {@condition restrained} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success. A creature resistance to cold damage has advantage on the saving throw and a creature immune to cold damage automatically succeeds the saving throw.

action.name: Show Collection
entries: The Collector reveals its true form from underneath its cloak. Each creature of the Collector's choice that can see it in a 15-foot cone must make a {@dc 14} Wisdom saving throw. action.name: Holy Mark
entries: The fanatic tries to brand a creature within 5 feet of himself with a holy mark. A creature must succeed on a {@dc 13} Dexterity saving throw or takes 4 ({@damage 1d8}) fire damage and is under the effect of Holy Mark for one minute or until the Fanatic uses this action again. The Fanatic has advantage on all attack rolls against the marked creature and is aware of its position if it is within 1000 feet of him.

entries: If the shrieker fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Thieving
entries: One per turn when the shrieker hits a creature with a peck attack, it can choose to not deal damage and attempt to steal an item out of the creature's inventory (Dungeon Master's choice) instead. The shrieker makes a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check opposed to the attacked creature's Wisdom (Perception) check. On a success the shrieker steals the item and carries it in its beak.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shrieker makes two peck attacks.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 9} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}14 ({@damage 2d8 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Caw
entries: The shrieker caws at a creature that can hear it within 60 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw or has disadvantage on all attack rolls against the Shrieker until the end of the shrieker's next turn. A creature that is immune to fear automatically succeeds the saving throw. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the shrieker's Caw for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Regurgitate
entries: The shrieker regurgitate partially digested food in a 15 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the shrieker's next turn.

action.name: Call the Murder {@recharge 5}
entries: The shrieker summons a swarm of spectral crows in a 20 ft. radius. Each creature of the shrieker's choice must make a {@dc 16} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 36 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and can't use reactions until the beginning of its next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and can't make opportunity attacks until the beginning of its next turn. If the Shrieker is within the radius of effect it can dash as a bonus action until the end of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The shrieker makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The shrieker moves up to half of its speed.

legendary.name: Skirmishing Peck (2 Actions)
entries: The shrieker walks up to half of its speed. It makes a peck attack before, after or during this movement.

trait.name: Keen Sight
entries: The shrieker has advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks that rely on sight.

trait.name: Mobile
entries: The shrieker attacks a creature with an attack, it won't provoke opportunity attacks from that creature for the rest of the turn, whether it hits or not.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the shrieker fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Thieving
entries: One per turn when the shrieker hits a creature with a peck attack, it can choose to not deal damage and attempt to steal an item out of the creature's inventory (Dungeon Master's choice) instead. The shrieker makes a Dexterity (Sleight of Hand) check opposed to the attacked creature's Wisdom (Perception) check. On a success the shrieker steals the item and carries it in its beak.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shrieker caws and makes two peck attacks.

action.name: Peck
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}19 ({@damage 3d8 + 6}) piercing damage.

The creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or has disadvantage on all attack rolls against the Shrieker until the end of the shrieker's next turn. A creature that is immune to fear automatically succeeds the saving throw. If a creature's saving throw is successful, the creature is immune to the shrieker's Caw for the next 24 hours.

action.name: Regurgitate
entries: The shrieker regurgitate partially digested food in a 20 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the shrieker's next turn.

action.name: Call the Murder {@recharge 5}
entries: The shrieker summons a swarm of spectral crows in a 20 ft. radius. Each creature of the shrieker's choice must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 45 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and can't use reactions until the beginning of its next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and can't make opportunity attacks until the beginning of its next turn. If the Shrieker is within the radius of effect it can dash as a bonus action until the end of its turn.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The shrieker makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The shrieker moves up to half of its speed.

legendary.name: Regurgitate (1/round)
entries: The shrieker uses Regurgitate.

legendary.name: Skirmishing Peck (2 Actions)
entries: The shrieker walks up to half of its speed. It makes a peck attack before, after or during this movement.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The cultist is a 14th-level spellcaster. Their spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 17}, +9 to hit with spell attacks). They regain their expended spell slots when they finish a short or long rest. They know the following spells:

action.name: Dagger
entries: {@atk mw,rw} {@hit +6} to hit, reach 5 ft. or range 20/60 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d4 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Fate's Reveal
entries: A creature within 120 ft. of the witch must succeed a {@dc 17} Charisma saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 13 ({@damage 2d6 + 6}) psychic damage is ingulfed in eldritch light for one minute. As long as the creature is ingulfed in eldritch light each attack against the creature is made with advantage and the creature cannot benefit from becoming {@condition invisible} or hide. At the end of the ingulfed creature's turn it repeats the saving throw, ending the effect on a success. Once a creature succeeds its saving throw or the effect ends, the creature becomes immune to the witch's Fate's Reveal for 24 hours.

trait.name: Rend for the New God
entries: When the brawler scores a hit with a melee weapon attack on a target, its melee weapon attacks have advantage on the same target until the beginning of its next turn.

trait.name: Rupturing Wounds
entries: When the brawler hits a creature with an attack made with advantage, the attack deals an additional 4 ({@damage 1d8}) necrotic damage. Creatures without blood are not affected.

trait.name: Unarmored Defense
entries: When the brawler is not wearing any armor, their armor class equals 10 + their Dexterity modifier + their Constitution modifier.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The brawler makes 3 claw attacks.

action.name: Claw
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 1d8 + 5}) slashing damage.

trait.name: Dark Devotion
entries: The cultist has advantage on saving throws against being {@condition charmed} or {@condition frightened}.

trait.name: Mob Attack
entries: When the raptorous cultist hits a creature that is within 5 ft. of one of the cultist's allies, that isn't {@condition incapacitated}, its attack deals an additional die of its damage ({@dice 1d6}).

trait.name: Prepare the Sacrifice
entries: As long as two raptorous cultists or more grapple the same creature, the creature is {@condition restrained}.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist makes 2 slam attacks

action.name: Slam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 4} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}5 ({@damage 1d6 + 2}) bludgeoning damage. Instead of dealing damage, the cultist can grapple the target (escape {@dc 12}).

action.name: Flesh to Flesh
entries: The cultist sacrifices its own flesh to mend the wounds of its ally. The cultist takes 17 ({@damage 3d8 + 3}) necrotic damage and an ally within 5 ft. of the cultist regains hit points equal to the amount of necrotic damage dealt.

action.name: Flesh Wall
entries: The cultist chooses one ally within 5 feet of itself. Until the beginning of the cultist's next turn any attack that targets the chosen ally targets the cultist instead as long as the cultist is within 5 feet of the chosen ally.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The cultist priest's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Visceral Hit
entries: When a creature is hit by the cultist priest's piercing appendage and the attack was made with advantage, the creature makes the Constitution saving throw with disadvantage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The cultist priest makes 2 tentacle attacks.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Piercing Appendage
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 8} to hit, reach 30 ft., one target. {@h}26 ({@damage 6d6 + 5}) piercing damage, plus 14 ({@damage 4d6}) necrotic damage if the target is a creature. The creature must make a {@dc 16} Constitution saving throw, taking the necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature without blood takes no necrotic damage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The growth's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage, plus 7 ({@damage 2d6}) necrotic damage. The creature must make a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw, taking the necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much damage on a successful one. A creature without blood takes no necrotic damage.

action.name: Mind Blast
entries: A creature that the growth can see must must succeed a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 9 ({@damage 2d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition stunned} until the end of the growth's next turn. A creature with Intelligence of 2 or lower is unaffected.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The growth's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Tendril
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Bolster
entries: A creature of the growth's choice gains 10 temporary hit points and when the creature makes an attack or saving throw before the beginning of the growth's next turn, it rolls {@dice 1d4} and adds the number rolled to the attack roll or saving throw.

action.name: Unbearable Reverberation
entries: Each creature of the growth's choice that can hear it and is within 30 ft. of it must succeed a {@dc 13} Wisdom saving throw or take 5 ({@damage 2d4}) psychic damage and when the creature makes an attack or ability check before the end of its next turn, it must roll {@dice 1d4} and subtract the number rolled from the attack roll or saving throw.

reaction.name: Intercepting Guard
entries: When a creature attacks an ally of the growth, the growth can impose disadvantage on the attack. To do s both the attacking creature and the ally of the growth must be within 30 ft. of it.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The templar's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The templar makes 3 attacks; two with its claws and one with its stinger. It can make a bodyslam attack in place of both claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinger
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

action.name: Bodyslam
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and if the creature is size large or smaller, the creature is pushed up to 10 ft. away from the templar. The pushed creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the templar's next turn.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The templar's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The templar makes 2 attacks with its claws or two with its stinger shot.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinger Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 8} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the templar's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Rain of Doom
entries: The templar fires venomous spikes in a 30 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must succeed a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

trait.name: Magic Resistance
entries: The templar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The templar's weapon attacks are magical.

entries: The templar makes 3 attacks; two with its claws and one with its stinger. It can make a bodyslam attack in place of both claw attacks.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d10 + 6}) bludgeoning damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw, taking 18 ({@damage 4d8}) poison damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one.

entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}24 ({@damage 4d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage and if the creature is size large or smaller, the creature is pushed up to 10 ft. away from the templar. The pushed creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the templar's next turn.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The templar warlord moves up to half of its speed.

legendary.name: Claws (2 Actions)
entries: The templar warlord attacks with its claws.

legendary.name: Rush (3 Actions)
entries: The templar warlord moves up to its speed and makes a bodyslam attack.

legendary.name: Revelation (3 Actions)
entries: The templar reveals a hidden eye that targets a creature within 60 ft. of the templar. If the creature can see the templar, must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage and the creature is under the effect of the Confusion spell until the end of the creature's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage. A creature that fails its saving throw by 5 or more becomes afflicted with indefinite madness.

entries: The templar has advantage on saving throws against spells and other magical effects.

entries: The templar's weapon attacks are magical.

entries: The templar makes 3 attacks; two with its claws and one with its stinger. It can make a bodyslam attack in place of both claw attacks.

action.name: Claws
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 11} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d8 + 6}) bludgeoning damage.

action.name: Stinger Shot
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 9} to hit, range 60/120 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage. The target must make a {@dc 17} Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage and is {@condition poisoned} until the end of the templar's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage and is not {@condition poisoned}.

action.name: Rain of Doom
entries: The templar fires venomous spikes in a 30 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must succeed a {@dc 19} Dexterity saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d6}) piercing damage and 13 ({@damage 3d8}) poison damage.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The templar impaler moves up to half of its speed.

legendary.name: Claws (2 Actions)
entries: The templar warlord attacks with its claws.

legendary.name: Retreat (3 Actions)
entries: The templar warlord moves up to half of its speed without provoking opportunity attacks and makes a stinger shot attack.

legendary.name: Revelation (3 Actions)
entries: The templar reveals a hidden eye that targets a creature within 60 ft. of the templar. If the creature can see the templar, must make a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 55 ({@damage 10d10}) psychic damage and the creature is under the effect of the Confusion spell until the end of the creature's next turn. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage. A creature that fails its saving throw by 5 or more becomes afflicted with indefinite madness.

trait.name: Dark Sight
entries: The horror can see normally in magical and nonmagical darkness, to a distance of 120 feet.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the horror fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The horror's weapon attacks are magical.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The horror's spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 19}). The horror can innately cast the following spells, requiring no material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The shambler makes four attacks: three with its barbed tendrils and one with its bite.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}17 ({@damage 2d8 + 8}) piercing damage.

action.name: Barbed Tendrils
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 14} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}13 ({@damage 1d10 + 8}) piercing damage and if the target is a creature it suffers a wound for one minute. A wounded creature suffers 5 ({@damage 2d4}) necrotic damage at the start of its turn for each wound and then makes a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all wounds on a success. Alternatively a creature can use an action to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check or spend one charge of a healer's kit to close all wounds on the creature and end the effect. A creature can have more than one wound.

action.name: Echoing Disassembly {@recharge 5}
entries: The horror lets out a mind rending scream in a 60 ft. cone. Each creature in the area must make a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 49 ({@damage 14d6}) psychic damage and be {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} for one minute. On a successful save a creature takes half as much damage. A {@condition blinded} and {@condition deafened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

legendary.name: Move
entries: The horror moves up to half of its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Tendrils
entries: The horror makes an attack with its tendrils.

legendary.name: Undulating Appendages
entries: A creature within 20 ft. of the horror must succeed a {@dc 22} Strength saving throw or be pulled or pushed 10 ft. in a direction of the horror's choice

legendary.name: Spawn Growth (2 Actions)
entries: The horror spawns a defensive growth in an empty space within 20 ft. of itself. If the horror spawns a growth and 2 growths it previously spawned are alive, one of the spawned growths dies.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The flesh hound's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Cruelty
entries: If the flesh hound hits with an attack that was made with advantage, it deals an additional 10 ({@damage 3d6}) damage.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The flesh hound makes 2 bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}12 ({@damage 2d8 + 3}) piercing damage.

action.name: Tentacle
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 6} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}8 ({@damage 2d4 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the creature is {@condition grappled}, escape {@dc 13}. The {@condition grappled} creature must succeed a {@dc 13} Constitution saving throw or is {@condition paralyzed} until the end of the flesh hound's next turn.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The polyp makes two bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 2d10 + 4}) piercing damage.

action.name: Phegm
entries: {@atk rw} {@hit 7} to hit, range 40/80 ft., one target. {@h}35 ({@damage 10d6}) poison damage and a creature is covered in venomous phlegm. Until a creature takes an action to remove the phlegm, a phlegm covered creature takes 10 ({@damage 3d6}) poison damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Banishing Pulse
entries: {@atk ms} {@hit 7} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}27 ({@damage 6d8}) force damage and the creature must succeed a {@dc 15} Strength saving throw or is pushed back up to 10 ft. away from the polyp.

trait.name: Aberrant Bond
entries: The polyp can telepathically communicate with any aberration within 120 ft. of itself.

trait.name: Aberrant Mark
entries: A creature that is covered in the polyp's phlegm alerts aberrations within 60 ft. to its presence, meaning the creature cannot benefit from being {@condition invisible} or hide from them, and any attack roll against the creature made by an aberration has advantage.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The polyp's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The mammoth cyst's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The mammoth cyst makes 2 bite attacks.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 10} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}15 ({@damage 3d6 + 5}) piercing damage.

action.name: Weakening Gaze
entries: The mammoth cyst looks at a creature within 60 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed a {@dc 18} Wisdom saving throw or take 45 ({@damage 8d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for one minute. A {@condition frightened} creature deals half as much damage with melee or ranged weapon attacks and repeats the saving throw at the end of its turn, ending the effect on a success.

action.name: Digestion
entries: A creature or two creatures within 5 ft. of each other within 60 ft. of the cyst must make a {@dc 18} Dexterity saving throw or take 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage. A creature that fails its saving throw takes 21 ({@damage 6d6}) acid damage at the beginning of its next turn.

action.name: Quickening {@recharge 5}
entries: The mammoth cyst regains 45 ({@dice 10d8}) hit points and any time the cyst deals damage to a target before the end of its next turn, it rolls twice for the damage and takes the higher amount.

legendary.name: Detect
entries: The mammoth cyst makes a Wisdom (Perception) check.

legendary.name: Bite
entries: The mammoth cyst makes a bite attack.

legendary.name: Spawn White Cell Stalk (2 Actions)
entries: The mammoth cyst spawns a white cell stalk at an empty space within 60 ft. of itself

legendary.name: Weakening Gaze (3 Actions)
entries: The mammoth cyst uses its Weakening Gaze.

legendary.name: Quickening (3 Actions)
entries: The mammoth cyst uses its quickening if available.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The white cell stalk's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Bite
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 2} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}3 ({@damage 1d6}) piercing damage.

action.name: Malevolent Displacement
entries: A creature within 60 ft. of the cell stalk must succeed a {@dc 15} Charisma saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and is teleported to an unoccupied space of the cell stalk's choice within 20 ft. of the creature's initial position. The space must be the ground or on a floor or platform.

action.name: Reconstitute {@recharge 5}
entries: An allied aberration within 60 ft. of the cell stalk regains 22 ({@dice 4d8 + 4}) hit points and the next time before the end of the allied aberration's next turn it takes damage from any source, the damage is reduced by 11 ({@dice 2d8 + 2}).

trait.name: Battle Cry: Reproduction
entries: When the Ancestor rolls initiative, he uses 3 legendary actions to use his Reproduction.

trait.name: Eldritch Protection
entries: The Ancestor adds his Charisma modifier to his armor class and hit points per hit dice.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the ancestor fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The the ancestor's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: One of a Whole
entries: The Ancestor is telepathically connected with his reflections. They can communicate with each other telepathically as long as they are on the same plane of existence and can see, feel, and hear what the other does.

spellcasting.name: Spellcasting
headerEntries: The Ancestor is a 20th level spellcaster. His spellcasting ability is Charisma (spell save {@dc 20}, +12 to hit with spell attacks). The Ancestor can cast the following spells without needing material components:

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Ancestor makes 2 reshape attacks.

action.name: Reshape
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 12} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}18 ({@damage 4d8}) necrotic damage and the target must succeed a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw or is effected by one of the following (Ancestor's Choice):
• Closed Mouth. The creature's mouth temporarily grows shut and the creature can't talk or use spells with vocal components until the end of the Ancestor's next turn.

• Stump Hand. The creature's hand temporarily devolves into a useless appendage, causing the creature to drop whatever item it is holding in that hand and the creature can't use the hand until it reshapes at the end of the Ancestors next turn.
• Tentacle Leg. The creature's leg temporarily shrivels to a writhing tentacle, causing the creature's speed to be reduced by half until the end of the Ancestor's next turn

legendary.name: Reposition
entries: The Ancestor teleports up to half of his teleportation speed.

legendary.name: Futility (2 Actions)
entries: The Ancestor projects his past existential dread upon a creature he can see with in 120 ft. of himself. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 20} Wisdom saving throw or has disadvantage on all ability checks, attack rolls, or saving throws until the end of the creature's next turn.

legendary.name: Time Heals All (2 Actions)
entries: The Ancestor creates a temporal annomaly that causes time to rapidly pass for each reflection within 120 ft. of him. Each reflection regains 22 ({@dice 4d8 + 4}) hit point and can move up to its speed without provoking opportunity attacks.

legendary.name: Reproduction (3 Actions)
entries: The Ancestor spawns up to 3 reflections within 20 ft. of himself. The reflections remain for 1 hour before having to return to the Ancestor. The Ancestor can have a maximum of 3 reflections spawned at a time.

legendary.name: Unmake (3 Actions)
entries: The Ancestor sends out a flesh rippling wave in a 60 ft. cone. Each creature of the Ancestor's choice in the area must succeed on a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 22 ({@damage 5d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. Constructs, spectral undead such as ghosts and other creatures not made from flesh and blood are unaffected.

trait.name: Coordinate
entries: The reflection has advantage on attack rolls against a target the Ancestor or another reflection has attacked since the end of the reflection's last turn.

trait.name: One of a Whole
entries: The reflection is telepathically connected with other reflections and the Ancestor. They can communicate with each other telepathically as long as they are on the same plane of existence and can see, feel, and hear what the other does.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The reflection's weapon attacks are magical.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The reflection makes 2 reuniting touch attacks.

action.name: Reuniting Touch
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 5 ft., one target. {@h}9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage. If the attack was made with advantage it deals an additional 9 ({@damage 2d8}) necrotic damage.

action.name: "It Chooses"
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 5} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}10 ({@damage 2d6 + 3}) bludgeoning damage and the target must succeed on a {@dc 15} Constitution saving throw or be {@condition stunned} until the end of the reflection's next turn.

action.name: "We Are the Same"
entries: The reflection quickly reveals its true form and the horrible truth of its kinship with a humanoid creature within 60 ft. of itself. If the creature can see the reflection, it must succeed on a {@dc 15} Wisdom saving throw or take 18 ({@damage 4d8}) psychic damage and be {@condition frightened} for one minute. A {@condition frightened} creature repeats the saving throw at the end of each of its turns, ending the condition on a success. If the creature's saving throw is successful, or the effect on it ends, the creature has advantage on saving throws against "We Are the Same" effects of all reflections for 1 hour.

trait.name: Aberrant Mind
entries: The Heart of Darkness has advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma saving throws against magic.

trait.name: Eldritch Ward
entries: The Heart of Darkness uses its Charisma modifier in place of its Dexterity to determine its armor class (AC).

trait.name: Dimension Locked
entries: The Heart of Darkness cannot be teleported, or transported to another plane of existence by any means.

trait.name: Heart of the World
entries: The Heart of Darkness' actual body encompasses the entirety of its Lair. In its Lair, its melee weapon attacks originate from the ground and walls, as it is able to manifest appendages from any part of its body. For the purpose of targets of game effects, the Heart itself (speaking this monster) is the only valid target as it is to be considered the Heart of Darkness' only weak spot. The Heart of Darkness can only make opportunity attacks against targets that move out of the reach of its weak spot (this monster).

trait.name: Immutable Form
entries: The the heart of darkness is immune to any spell or effect that would alter its form.

trait.name: Legendary Resistance (3/Day)
entries: If the the heart of darkness fails a saving throw, it can choose to succeed instead.

trait.name: Magic Weapons
entries: The the heart of darkness's weapon attacks are magical.

trait.name: Realm Awareness
entries: The Heart of Darkness is aware of any creature in its Lair, as if it can see it.

action.name: Multiattack
entries: The Heart of Darkness makes 2 puncture attacks.

action.name: Puncture
entries: {@atk mw} {@hit 13} to hit, reach 10 ft., one target. {@h}28 ({@damage 4d10 + 6}) piercing damage and the creature suffers a wound. A wounded creature suffers 10 ({@damage 4d4}) necrotic damage at the start of its turn for each wound and then makes a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, ending the effect of all wounds on a success. Alternatively a creature can use an action to make a {@dc 20} Wisdom (Medicine) check or spend one charge of a healer's kit to close all wounds on the creature and end the effect. A creature can have more than one wound.

action.name: Dissolution
entries: The Heart of Darkness spews acid at a creature it can see within 60 ft. of itself. The creature must succeed a {@dc 20} Dexterity saving throw or take 48 ({@damage 14d6}) acid damage and is covered in acid. Until a creature takes an action to remove the acid, the target takes 14 ({@damage 4d6}) acid damage at the start of each of its turns.

action.name: Revelation
entries: The Heart of Darkness reveals its cosmic truth to a creature to break its mind. The creature must succeed on a {@dc 21} Wisdom saving throw or take 40 ({@damage 10d8}) psychic damage and is {@condition incapacitated} until the end of the Heart's next turn.

action.name: Return the Errant Flesh (1/day)
entries: The Heart of Darkness attempts to return a creature within 10 ft. of itself, the ground or walls of its lair back to its collective. The creature must make a {@dc 20} Constitution saving throw, taking 90 ({@damage 20d8}) necrotic damage on a failed save and half as much on a successful one. If the creature fails the saving throw and the damage reduces the creature to 0 hit points, it dies and becomes part of the Heart of Darkness.

legendary.name: Puncture
entries: The Heart of Darkness makes a puncture attack.

legendary.name: Dissolution (2 Actions)
entries: The Heart of Darkness uses its dissolution.

legendary.name: Revelation (2 Actions)
entries: The Heart of Darkness uses its revelation.

legendaryGroup.name: Viscount
lairActions: When fighting the Viscount in his dining room, the Viscount can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Viscount takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects.

• The Viscount moves up to his speed to one of the sacs and takes a bite out of it. He regenerated hit points according to the sac's size. Additionally the Viscount gains one of the following boons until initiative count 20 of the next turn depending on the size of the sac:
Small - Any attack of the Viscount made scores a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.
Medium - The Viscount's movement speed is increased by 20 and he has a +2 bonus to armor class.
Large - Any creature the Viscount sees is treated as if under the effect of Hungry Eyes and anytime the Viscount deals damage with an attack he rolls the damage twice, taking the higher result.

• The Viscount can't deny his urges any longer and picks up a piece of rotting morsel from the ground as a snack. Each creature that can see the Viscount within 20 ft. of it must make a DC 15 Wisdom saving throw or has disadvantage on the first attack roll or skill check it makes before the end of its next turn. A creature that fails the saving throw by 5 or more is also poisoned until the end of its next turn.

legendaryGroup.name: Countess
lairActions: When fighting the Countess in her nest, the Countess can take lair actions. On initiative count 20 (losing initiative ties), the Countess takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects.
• One of the pulsating eggs bursts open and spawns a sycophant (champion). The sycophant is loyal to the Countess and joins the battle.

• An agitated swarm of mosquitos forms around a non-bloodsucker creature in the area until the Countess uses another lair action. The swarm occupies a 10 ft. radius centered on the target creature and follows the creature up to 60 ft. from its point of origin. The area of the swarm is heavily obscured. A creature non-bloodsucker creature that starts its turn within the area of the swarm or enters the area for the first time during its turn takes 10 (4d4) piercing damage.

• A creature infested with a parasitic egg must succeed a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or must use a reaction to move up to half of its speed and make a melee weapon attack with the weapon or object in its hand against the nearest non-bloodsucker creature it can see. A creature immune to charm automatically succeeds the saving throw.

• The buzzing insects in the air buzz in a maddening cacophony. Each non-bloodsucker creature in the nest must succeed a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed check whenever a creature makes an ability check, attack roll or saving throw before the end of its next turn, must roll a 1d6 and subtract the number rolled from the ability check, attack roll or saving throw. Deaf creatures are not affected.
regionalEffects: Unsurprisingly, the Nest is a gathering point for many of the court's bloodsucker and mutated insectoids. Beyond the concentration of mosquitos and bloodsuckers in the region, the nest causes one or more of the following effects:
• Creatures that spend a long rest within 6 miles of the Nest must succeed a DC 16 Constitution saving throw or contract a random bloodborne disease.
• The sky within 2 miles of the nest is covered by mist and buzzing insects, causing no sunlight to reach the area and muting it down to dim light instead.
• The waters of the marches within 3 miles of the nest are heavily infested with mosquito larvae and leeches.
If the Countess is slain, these effects fade over the course of 2d6 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Sleeper
lairActions: On Initiative count 20 (losing Initiative ties), the Sleeper takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Sleeper can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

• Time begins to bend in a 10 ft. radius sphere within 120 ft. of the Sleeper. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Charisma saving throw. On a failed save a creature is slowed, as if under the effect of the Slow spell until the end of its next turn.

• A spatial rift erupts in a 60 ft. radius around the Sleeper. Each creature in the area must except for the Sleeper must succeed a DC 13 Constitution saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 14 (4d6) force damage and switches positions with another random creature that also failed its saving throw.

• An explosive crystalline growth shoots out of the earth, creating a 5 ft. high, 20 ft. radius area of crystal spikes. Each creature in the area must make a DC 15 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed save a creature takes 18 (4d8) piercing damage, and half as much on a successful one. The area is difficult terrain and remains until Initiative count 20 on the next round.
regionalEffects: The region of the farmstead, or any other region warped by the presence of the Sleeper and its impact creates one or more of the following effects:

• Space is non euclidian which causes strange bends in reality and incidental loops in space. When traveling the actual distance traveled can vary up to 20%. So a journey of 10 miles through the farmstead becomes between 8 and 12 miles long. This can be determined by rolling a 1d20.

• Creatures traveling through the farmstead experience rapid aging, causing them to age 1 year for each week spent in the farmstead - alternatively creatures traveling through the farmstead experience time dilation in which one month passes for every day they spend in the farmstead.

• Gravity acts strange and unpredictable within the farmstead, causing random objects or structures to float, and others to be completely locked in space, unable to be moved at all. Creatures are unable to fly or float using magic of any kind.
If the Sleeper dies, these effects fade over the course of 1d100 days.

legendaryGroup.name: Heart of Darkness
lairActions: On Initiative count 20 (losing Initiative ties), the Heart of Darkness takes a lair action to cause one of the following effects; the Heart of Darkness can't use the same effect two rounds in a row:

• The Heart of Darkness targets a creature, object, or magical effect in its lair. It attempts to end one spell on the target. A 3rd level or lower spell on the target ends automatically. For a spell of 4th level or higher the Heart of Darkness must make a Charisma check. The DC equals 10 + the spell's level. On a success the spell ends.

• A dying creature laying on the ground or within 10 ft. of a wall must make a DC 18 Constitution saving throw or be partially absorbed into the room, causing it to suffer 2 death saving throw failures. If this kills the creature it is absorbed into the Heart of Darkness.

• The Heart of Darkness convulses and a 10 foot square area on the ground within the lair bulges upwards. Each creature on the ground in that area must succeed a DC 18 Dexterity saving throw or be launched 20 ft. into the air.

• The Heart of Darkness' beat speeds up and becomes unbearable to listen to. Each creature in the lair except for the Heart of Darkness that is not deaf, must succeed on a DC 18 Wisdom saving throw or is distracted until the Heart of Darkness uses another lair action. When a distracted creature makes an ability check, attack roll, or saving throw, it subtracts 1d6 from the roll.

• The Heart of Darkness manifests hundereds of dark eyes along the walls and floor of the lair, all focusing on one creature in the lair. The Heart of Darkness has advantage on all attack rolls against the creature until it uses another lair action.
